bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding the notice of meetings of the State Board of Funeral Service.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the notice of meetings of the State Board of Funeral Service. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-19-6 be amended to read as follows: 36-19-6. The State Board of Funeral Service shall meet at least once a year , and may also hold special meetings as frequently as the proper and efficient discharge of its duties shall require , at a time and place to be fixed by the rules and regulations of the board, provided that at least ten days before each regular or special meeting, the board shall mail by first class mail to each licensee under this chapter, residing in this state, a written notice of the time and place of such meeting. The rules and regulations of the board shall provide for the giving of timely notice of all meetings to every member of the board . Four members shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the notice of meetings of the State Board of Funeral Service. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-19-6 be amended to read as follows: 36-19-6. The State Board of Funeral Service shall meet at least once a year , and may also hold special meetings as frequently as the proper and efficient discharge of its duties shall require, at a time and place to be fixed by the rules and regulations of the board, provided that at least ten days before each regular or special meeting, the board shall mail by first class mail to each licensee under this chapter, residing in this state, a written notice of the time and place of such meeting. The rules and regulations of the board shall provide for the giving of timely notice of all meetings to every member of the board requires . Four members shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business. BILL HISTORY 1/12/99 First read in Senate and referred to Commerce. S.J. 23 1/14/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/14/99 Commerce Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 44 1/14/99 Commerce Place on Consent Calendar.
